title.narrative: Provision of immediate GBV Child Protection services and assessment assistance of ES/NFIs to IDPs, Returnees and Host Communities in Hilmand, Kandahar, Urozgan and Takhar, Provinces

description.narrative: The intervention proposed by APA intends to provide an integrated approach to address the specific needs identified by the assessment conducted by APA in December 2017 at Hilmand, Kandahar, Urozgan and Takhar Provinces. APA has designed this integrated project envisages wide-ranging multi-sectorial services in the sphere of GBV, Child Protection and ES/NFIs assessment of IDPs, returnees and host communities through the following activities: A. Protection/GBV: a) Establishment of (WFHS) in Trinkut that will be managed by female PSS Counsellor / midwife as part of the GBV SC reactive approach. b) Provide a comprehensive and blanket psychosocial support, counseling and community awareness to IDPs, returnees and host community women and girls through WFHSs by trained PSS counselor. c) Distribution of DKs to the reproductive age women as the community entry point, to build trust on women participation and seek GBV support. d) APA will appoint 5 mobile teams 1 team for Nahreseraj of Hilmand, 1 for Shahwalikot and Daman of Kandahar, 1 for Dehrawud of Urozgan and 2 for Khwajabahawuddin and Darqad districts of Takhar. GBV mobile team will be providing mobile psycho-social support/counseling and community awareness to women and girls who do not have access to WFHSs, this service will also be extended to men and boys. Each team will be comprised of trained female midwife / PSS counselor and male community mobilizer. The mobile teams will mobilize the community through community-wide meetings with elders/CDCs in CDCs and Masjids as part of GBV SC proactive approach. e) Community mobilizer will coordinate with community members, PSS counselor will provide blanket PSS services and will identify cases with specialized care/services/counseling, reproductive health information/services, rights awareness to women. f) APA will continue to work with community to capacitate them in gender and age tailored, awareness raising on GBV, PSS wellbeing, protection principles and referral mechanisms g) Establish a mechanism for referring GBV survivors to other stakeholders for provision of advanced medical care, legal and justice in coordination with DoWAs, AIHRC and UNFPA. B. Child Protection: APA will establish Child Friendly Space with coordination of IDPs, host communities and other stakeholders and will mobilize the target group to be enrolled in Child Friendly Spaces for protective services and will establish Child Rights Councils (Comprising of Parents and General Community Members) for ensuring children/community involvement in protection services. The tasks undertaking together by Child Protection mobile teams are carrying out Protection, Health amp Hygiene, Fatal Diseases and CSA) services to girls and boys within the CFSs and through a mobile team and will maintain a well comprehensive community based approach as community involvement for management and referrals of the critical cases of survivors to other stakeholders for advanced protection services. psychosocial support and counseling sessions for individuals and groups of the vulnerable girls and boys will also be provided. Community based awareness raising will be carried out on child protection issues through community dialogues. This will include leaflets, fliers, conducting group sessions with community heads and religious peoples in separate groups for women and men. C. Shelter/NFIs: a) ES/NFIs assessment amp distribution teams will conduct ES/NFI assessment for 29% (21,000 male/female individual) of 74,517 IDPs, returnees and host communities in (Nad Ali of Hilmand and Dehrawud and Trinkut districts of Urozgan Provinces. b) APA ES/NFI staff have already got required training from REACH and will use smartphones / tables for data collection c) APA will also provide emergency response to extremely vulnerable needy cases through distribution of ES/NFIs Kits
